TopicTitle: Bitsat mirco probe. Cheap science at under 0.9t!

Articles.Content:
Want to add a probe to your mission that isn't heavy and doesn't cost a lot so you can grab some cheap extra science? Then you need the Bitsat! Kerbal engineers have been struggling with budget cuts due to so many mission failures and have resorted to taking any old parts they find in dumpsters, gluing them together, and reselling them as "new products".

This tiny probe uses RCS propulsion to get around. Its dual solar panels and tiny battery will keep it humming along all the way down until it crashes into the surface, or doesn't crash, whichever.

Stats:

Weight : 0.855t

Delta V : 1940

Funds cost (without science gear) : 3570

Use, remove or replace the existing science stuff glued to the sides with whatever you want! Glue removing solvent sold separately.

Comes with 5, yes that's right, FIVE antennas! 4 of them are just for looks, but I mean, look at it! Cool right? (Ensure you extend antennas for maximum coolness factor)

Or, download it for free, which is also cool

[url="[![u8sRzMZh.png](http://i.imgur.com/u8sRzMZh.png)](http://imgur.com/u8sRzMZ)"]DOWNLOAD FROM MEDIAFIRE

How to use: Attach a decoupler to the bottom of it like any other rocket. To fly, ensure RCS is on and throttle up. For more detailed instructions on how to fly a probe, please google "KSP how to fly a rocket".

Cheers!
